articles.title: Loki Has Always Been Marvel’s Most Queer Character
articles.description: The character’s identity—rooted in sexually fluid Norse mythology—goes far beyond any form of queerness TV has ever seen before.
articles.content: In the second episode of Disney+s latest Marvel series, Loki, the title character pulls off his most illustrious trick yet: meeting himself. Working under the auspices of the Time Variance Authorityt… [+3980 chars]

articles.author: Matt Simon
articles.title: Why Utilities Want to Control Your Smart Thermostat
articles.description: Don’t mess with Texans’ air conditioning. Here’s why some customers in the state had their thermostats remotely controlled.
articles.content: One of modern lifes most satisfying certainties is dialing in the AC and sitting back as the room magically maintains your temperature of choice. But last week, owners of smart thermostats in Texas r… [+4105 chars]

articles.author: Meghan Herbst
articles.title: Test Out Next-Gen Space Tech in Kerbal Space Program
articles.description: Sure, a real-life Epstein drive is still a few breakthroughs away. But the rocket-building game lets you pilot a fusion-propelled craft right now.
articles.content: Most games lose relevance after a few years, but the indie rocket-building game Kerbal Space Program is a bit different. Its a glitchy, 10-year-old underdog of a game with a cult following of program… [+4856 chars]

articles.author: Tom Simonite
articles.title: Apple and Google’s New AI Wizardry Promises Privacy—at a Cost
articles.description: The companies revealed upgrades for their phones that protect data and reduce reliance on the cloud. It also binds users more tightly to their ecosystems.
